Text: The matriarchs have spoken, Aloy. All we can do is fight - and pray to the Goddess.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Mother’s Crown guards the edge of the Sacred Land, right? So do you see a lot of foreigners here?

Speaker: Marea
Text: Yes. Not here in the village itself, of course, but in the valley beyond. Since the war ended, foreigners have been allowed in the valley, and Nora can trade with them, if they choose. It’s a kind of in-between place, neither foreign nor Sacred Land. If you’re curious, visit Hunters’ Gathering. It’s little more than a heap of dingy shelters and tents, but foreigners use it as a waystation.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Sounds like a place where I could find out more about Meridian. So you’re in charge of the defenses here?

Speaker: Marea
Text: I have Sona’s counsel - though she really should rest.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Good luck convincing her to do that.

Speaker: Marea
Text: Mother’s Crown defends itself. During the war, it survived fifteen assaults, broke three invasion. We will endure.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Trying to live up to glorious pasts has a way of getting people killed.

Speaker: Marea
Text: You wouldn’t not know this, but I won the Proving the year I ran. Like you, I started off behind, had to find a shortcut. I barely made it. Crossed the finish line with a broken ankle.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: This isn’t the Proving, Marea. This is real.

Speaker: Marea
Text: You miss my point. Getting posted to Mother’s Crown? It was the boon I requested. My price for winning. Trying to live up to the glory of the Nora hasn’t killed me yet. But if it has to… I’m willing.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I should be going.

Speaker: Marea
Text: All right. Be careful out there, Aloy. I hope you find whatever it is you’re after.
[Aloy clears the corrupted zones that Marea told her about.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’ve done what I can to cleanse this valley of Corruption… time to see if the Carja fort will let me pass over the mountains.
[She goes to the border fort.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Sounds of fighting? Has something attacked the Carja fort? A Corruptor!

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: Turn back, girl! These machines are dangerous!
[But he doesn’t know who Aloy is. She destroy the Corruptor and several corrupted machines with it.]

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: Truly the Sun shines upon us this day!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: It wasn’t the Sun risking its ass down here.

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: Girl -- approach. Girl -- come closer!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So. Will you open the gate for me now?

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: You heard her! Open the gates -- and send word to Captain Balahn! Where are you headed, girl?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: West! To Meridian!

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: The Way of Broken Stones is a hard run, even in the best of times. You might want to have a word with Captain Balahn. He came from Meridian not long ago. You’ll find him in the fort - on a balcony to the left, overlooking the valley.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Okay. Thanks.

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: We’re the ones who should be thanking you, for taking down those machines. Walk in light, Nora.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: My whole life... all of it in the Embrace. The world just got bigger. But also more dangerous.
[She sees a hunter walking the road.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Are you all right, hunter? Were you injured when the War Party was ambushed?

Speaker: Cren
Text: Not exactly. And I’m not a hunter. Or a brave. Or anything, really. You shouldn’t even be talking to me.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Well, whoever you are, you’re hurt. What happened?

Speaker: Cren
Text: My name’s Cren, I thought I’d have a go at the Trials at the Hunting Grounds over the rise. You know, hone my skills. It... uh... didn’t go very well.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You got Injured at a Hunting Grounds? How?

Speaker: Cren
Text: Well, I was aiming for a canister on the back of a Grazer, and my bowstring snapped, and I tripped, and… Aw, forget it. It wasn’t pretty, okay? I just wanted to train a bit. Hunting Grounds are perfect for that. They offer Trials, which are like challenges, and they give you marks if you accomplish objectives or beat certain times. The Keeper’s up there on the hill, just to the north Talk to hum to do a Trial. I’m sure you’ll do better than I did.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Why did you say you weren’t "anything at all?" And that I shouldn’t talk to you?

Speaker: Cren
Text: I stole a bow, okay? And got cast out. This was before the Proving, so now I can’t even fight for my tribe in its time of need. I have to live in the wilds, by myself. Which is why I wanted some training. Honestly, I’m just glad the Keeper would talk to me. I think he might be an exile or something. He doesn’t seem to care about the laws of the Matriarchs.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Things aren’t exactly going your way, are they? Is there anything I can do to help?

Speaker: Cren
Text: No, no I’ll be all right. My father always said All-Mother had a plan for me. Before he got run over by a Strider, anyway.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I need to get going, Cren.

Speaker: Cren
Text: All right. Be careful, especially if you’re heading north. And be sure to hit the Hunting Grounds if you want to train up.
[Up a hill Aloy find the Keeper.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I spoke to Cren. He told me this is a Hunting Grounds, where you offer tests of skill.

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: Poor Cren. Not the best hunter, but at least he keeps his chin up. Hmm. You bear the Mark of a Seeker. I’ve heard of those, but never seen one. You have the Matriarch’s leave to come and go as you like from the Sacred Land?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Yes, but I would have gone even without their permission.

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: Is that so? Then maybe you and I can speak plainly. Truth is, I’ve had dealings with the Carja. I represent an organization called the Hunters Lodge in Meridian. We test promising young hunters with Trials at places like these. You might be just the kind of person we’re looking for. Why don’t you sample the Trials and see? Just to be clear, though - I’d appreciate it if you kept our conversation in confidence, especially when it comes to the Matriarchs.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You’re not supposed to be here, are you?

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: No. My friend and I left the Sacred Land and returned. The Matriarchs wouldn’t approve, to say the least. We’re hunters at heart. Left because we wanted to find new herds and new machines. That’s why the Hunters Lodge appealed to us. But the Carja wouldn’t have us if they knew we were Nora, so we wore Carja clothes when we brought our marks to them. After a while it felt like we were caught between worlds. Not quite Carja, not quite Nora. We started to miss home. So we came back and set up our own Hunting Grounds.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You think it will work, staying here without the Matriarchs’ permission?

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: I’m not sure. But we don’t believe in their rules. There’s a big world out there, and ignoring it doesn’t help anyone.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Tell me about the Trials.

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: The Hunters Lodge hosts Hunting Ground Trials throughout the world, each offering hunters a chance to test their skills.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What do I get for completing them?

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: Pride in accomplishment! As well as marks, depending on how well you fare. Here we offer the Tools Trials.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What kind of tools?

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: Hunting isn’t just about your bow - it’s about using everything available to you, even your surroundings. You’ll see once you start taking the Trials.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What is the Hunters Lodge?

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: It’s a group of hunters who compete to bring down the mightiest machines in the land, run by the Carja in Meridian. You can see it yourself if you win three Half Suns from the Hunting Grounds. Just to warn you, though, they’re not fond of Nora. Ready to choose your Trial? Take your pick. Which Trial interests you? I’ll give you the details.
[Aloy chooses “Parts Alone Trial”.]

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: Test your skill with bow and arrow by shooting parts off the backs of Grazers as quickly as possible.
[Aloy accepts the trial.]

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: Can’t wait to see what you do with that. Ready when you are!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: There’s gotta be a way to override even these things.
[She complete the trial with the highest rank.]

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: Yes! I finally found someone who could earn this Full Sun.
[Aloy chooses “Logpile Trial”.]

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: This Trial tests your ability to use the environment to your advantage. Shoot log piles to make them fall, crushing machines below. Remember, you can use explosions from your Blast Sling to scare machines into fleeing where you want them to go.
[Aloy accepts the trial.]

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: Perfect. I’ll start timing when you start down a rope.
[She complete the trial with the highest rank.]

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: How’d you--? First time and you win a Blazing Sun! You’re good, even for a Nora.
[Aloy chooses “Blast Wire Trial”.]

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: Use your Blast Wire and Carja Tripcaster to bring down Grazers. I’ll be timing you. Explosions scare them, so you may want to use your Blast Sling to drive them into your traps.
[Aloy accepts the trial.]

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: I like that one. Slide down a rope and I’ll start timing.

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: How’d you—? First time and you win a Blazing Sun! You’re good, even for a Nora. You have everything you need to enter the Hunters Lodge. Good luck in Meridian! Of course, you can still run more Trials with me.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I have to go.

Speaker: Nora Keeper
Text: I’ll be here if you decide to come back.
[Aloy continues to explore, and finds a man at whose feet lies several dead bodies.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: That man... he doesn’t look Nora.

Speaker: Nll
Text: There’s danger ahead, girl.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Danger for you, outlander. This is Nora land.

Speaker: Nil
Text: Yes, yes, yes, trespass is forbidden on pain of death... Strange phrase, the pain of death. See, this one’s in no pain at all.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Who was he?

Speaker: Nil
Text: A thief, a slaver, a killer-- the kind that give honest killers a bad name.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Varl told me there would be bandit ambushes on the road.

Speaker: Nil
Text: Well, it’s not all good news. They don’t always come to you. Most dig out a camp, and there they’ll sit, like spoil on meat.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Unless... someone does something about it?

Speaker: Nil
Text: I like you. Follow the trail of smoke, on the other side of the ruins. I’ll be there.
[Aloy saddles up her “horse” and sets off on the road.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: My Focus is picking up some kind of signal. Maybe I can scan it. Those ruins... that must be Devil’s Thirst. A city of the Old Ones. Of the Metal World. That signal... where is it coming from? I have three Suns-- now they’ll let me inside the Hunters Lodge. Well, let’s see how that turns out. A Nora village, up on the heights…
[She finds the place of Sona’s bloody battle with machines.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: This must be where the War Party got massacred. Such destruction… Maybe the War-Chief left something behind, some clue about as to where she went. Lots of Machines, all controlled by the killers. The Nora managed to take down a Corruptor. They sent a stampede of them down the slope. But not before the killers used it to send the other Machines against them. Look at this place. It’s like Varl said -- another massacre.
[A hunter runs out to the clearing. Exhausted, he falls to the ground.]

Speaker: Dran
Text: Brave! Let us speak! The dead and wounded, all cleared away Are there no more braves or healers here?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Just me. You’re hurt. What happened?

Speaker: Dran
Text: What didn’t? It’s madness out there. War-Chief Sona sent me back to report. I’m no good to her like this.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Varl told me that the War-Chief tracked the killers. Did she find them?

Speaker: Dran
Text: We followed their trail, but again and again they sent corrupted machines to attack us. My wounds started to slow me down, so the War-Chief sent me back to let others know she hasn’t given up the fight.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So you were here when the war party was ambushed?

Speaker: Dran
Text: I was. I thought after the Proving there could be no darker day, but was wrong. The War-Chief was delayed, gathering the rear-guard. Eager for revenge, the braves in the lead, fell into the trap. Dozens, lost in minutes. If Sona hadn’t arrived and rallied us, no one would’ve survived.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Varl sent me to look for Sona. Do you know where she’s now?

Speaker: Dran
Text: All I can tell you is where we parted - near the metal tower southeast of the rus at Devil’s Thirst. Look to the rise behind it, with a lone boulder. I’ll head for the Embrace and report what I know to Varl and the others. May All-Mother lend you strength - you’ll need t, going alone.
[Aloy ride to Sona’s last known location.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Tallneck… Looks just like Rost described. Not enough handholds to climb those legs. there must be another way. Low and quiet does it. Passed the test. All right. Now I just have to reach its head. I know, I know. I wouldn’t want to be poked in the head, either. So the Tallneck remembers everything along its path and sends what it sees to other machines.
[She found her first Vintage Cache.]

Speaker: Bashar Mati
Text: Apocashitstorm Tour, day 4. It’s hard to believe Metallurgic International used to be headquartered in this dreaded old ziggurat. Wyatt’s office was on the second floor from the top. If M.Int had a policy against workplace romances, he probably wrote it.
[By nightfall, Aloy manages to find the place Dran was talking about. She investigate it..]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: This must be the rise Sona’s runner told me about. Arrow shards. Braves were crafting ammunition here. A recent kill, freshly skinned. The War-Chief stopped here. So where did she go next? That old bow has seen a lot of action. No one would have left it willingly. Sona’s taking losses. They must have taken a moment to rest. Couldn’t have been easy going on after the ambush. Sona and her braves can’t be far. Dressings for wounds. The runner wasn’t the only one who got hurt. Might be a blood trail I could follow. I should try my Focus.
[She saddles up.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Tracks. Boots and blood. Looks like Sona and her braves headed for that ridge. A dead Sawtooth. Maybe Sona took it out? She could be close.

[While she’s examining a corpse, another Sawtooth sneaks up on her from behind. Aloy notices him too late. He is already preparing to attack when suddenly someone pierced him by an arrow. Having failed to keep his balance, Sawtooth falls off the cliff. Aloy aims at the one who fired the arrow, but when he sees who fired it, she lowers her bow.]

Speaker: Sona
Text: You’re lucky happened by. One heartbeat more, and that Sawtooth would’ve torn you apart.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Half a heartbeat more, and I would’ve killed it myself. Uh, so you’re War-Chief Sona? Varl asked me to find you.

Speaker: Sona
Text: Has he held the gate?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: He has -- bravely. I saw him kill a corrupted machine himself. But he worries for you.

Speaker: Sona
Text: Our tribe needs strength, not sentiment I’ve tracked some of the killers who struck the Proving. I crave vengeance. Do you?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Oh, you have no idea.

Speaker: Sona
Text: Show me, then. Lend me your strength. Follow. The killers are just across this ridge, digging the cursed earth. The sin of the ancients is buried in that soil. Corruptor demons.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I know of them! I killed one at Mother’s Watch!

Speaker: Sona
Text: A bold claim. I wonder if you’ll live up to it. Hours ago, I sent braves into hiding in the trees below. On my signal they’ll attack. The enemy and of their demonic machines outnumber us, but we will have fury on our side.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: We could have more than that.

Speaker: Sona
Text: Explain.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: That’s Blaze. What we use to burn, they use to blast -- it’s how they dug out this pit.

Speaker: Sona
Text: So we put fire to it, and then?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Boom.

Speaker: Sona
Text: Then let us begin.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Whoa -- wait. Let’s not rush. Give me some time to make an approach. If I end up alerting them, open fire.

Speaker: Sona
Text: All right. Let’s see what you can do.
[Aloy cautiously sneaks into the camp of cultists and kills them one by one.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: They’re still looking. Can feel the corruption boiling off it! Goodbye, quiet approach.
[Soon all the cultists and corrupt machines are killed.]

Speaker: Sona
Text: This wasn’t all the killers, I counted more at the War Party massacre. If I have to... chase their filthy shadows from here to Spear’s Reach... I will.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You’re hurt. Losing blood.

Speaker: Sona
Text: My health is not your concern.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: No one doubts your determination. But you need to rest.

Speaker: Varl
Text: She’s right, War-Chief. Give your wounds time to close.

Speaker: Sona
Text: Varl?! What are you doing here?! I ordered you to hold that gate with your life!

Speaker: Varl
Text: And so I did -- until the runner you sent returned with news of his encounter with Aloy and your location. I left the gate well-guarded. My place is here, with you. With our vengeance. Am I not owed that?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Maybe I should have a look around, see if I can figure out where the rest of the killers are.

Speaker: Sona
Text: Do as you wish. Everyone else does.

Speaker: Varl
Text: Mother…
[Aloy search the camp and find datapoint in one of the shacks. She read it with her Focus.]

Speaker: Eclipse Officer
Text: Commanders -- Over the past month, accidental Blaze explosions have killed a dozen men. Here in the Ring of Metal, I’ve taken the precaution of placing our entire stockpile in a covered shelter safe from stray sparks and lightning. And I’ve posted guards to control access. I urge you to take similar measures -- or suffer the consequences. Supply-master Thiran, out.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Hmm. A Blaze stockpile inside their base... Sabotage that, and we win.
[She goes back to Sona.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I found something. The rest of the killers are camped inside a “Ring of Metal". Any idea what that means?

Speaker: Sona
Text: Damn them. The Ring of Metal lies in the ruins of Devil’s Grief. That ground is taboo. I will return to the Matriarchs... beg them to make an exception.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: There’s no time for that.

Speaker: Varl
Text: Blood spilled calls for blood spilled! If the ground is cursed, then let our vengeance sanctify it!

Speaker: Sona
Text: You blaspheme…!

Speaker: Varl
Text: Please, War-Chief -- break the taboo!

Speaker: Sona
Text: Devil’s Grief is a cursed place... but maybe Aloy’s Seeker blessing can protect us. I’ll send scouts ahead. Our force will assemble at the cliff above Red Echoes, and launch our attack from there.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Sounds like a plan. See you there.

Speaker: Varl
Text: Aloy. Thank you.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You might take that back, when you see what I’m getting us into.

Speaker: Varl
Text: On to Devil’s Grief, then.
[Aloy comes to meet with Varl and Sona.]

Speaker: Varl
Text: Devil’s Grief... A foreboding sight, huh?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Don’t you even wonder what it used to look like, back when the Old Ones lived here?

Speaker: Varl
Text: You’re not like other Nora.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: That’s what they tell me.

Speaker: Varl
Text: War-Chief. Our scouts found enemy camps in the ruins, guarding the approach to the Ring of Metal.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Then we should hit those camps first. Make sure they stay quiet.

Speaker: Sona
Text: Agreed. Wipe out the camps, and our enemies in the Ring of Metal won’t see us coming.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’ll take out the alarms.

Speaker: Varl
Text: We’ll send braves to each camp to lie wait. What you start, they’ll help finish.
[Aloy goes to disable 3 alarms in 3 different camps around her main target.]

Speaker: Sona
Text: Braves, it is time! Time to fight! Time to kill! Maybe time to die! We will regroup there at the base of the tallest tower! Then to the Ring of Metal -- and vengeance! Today, we break taboo -- to honor our dead, and punish our enemies! Blood spilled for blood spilled! May All-Mother forgive our trespass! And if not, may she lay her wrath solely upon me!

Speaker: Nora Brave
Text: We are all braves today!

Speaker: Nora Brave
Text: We did it!

Speaker: Nora Brave
Text: Always have faith in the Nora!

Speaker: Nora Brave
Text: Victory for All Mother!

Speaker: Nora Brave
Text: For the Nora!
[After dealing with the camps Aloy goes to the Tallest Tower to met Sona and Varl.]

Speaker: Sona
Text: The camps have been dealt with. Now to the Ring of Metal. Its high walls protect the enemy. We’ll have to scale the height, under.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I have another idea. Their base has a weakness. Send me alone, and I’ll exploit it. If I’m successful, I’ll blow a hole in those walls big enough for the entire War Party to charge through.

Speaker: Varl
Text: Sounds like a plan -- so long as I get to come with you.

Speaker: Sona
Text: A War-Chief should be grateful for two arrows so eager to spring from the bow. Yes, Varl, go with Aloy as her spearmate. But be vigilant.

Speaker: Varl
Text: Yes, War-Chief. I will.

Speaker: Sona
Text: Go now. We wait on your signal.
[They hit the road.]

Speaker: Varl
Text: You do have a plan right?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You’ve followed me this far, even into the ruins I thought you trusted me.

Speaker: Varl
Text: I do. But how would you know that this base has a weakness?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Patience, Varl. You’ll know soon enough. Up you go.

Speaker: Varl
Text: Take my hand.
[They climb inside the huge building destroyed by time.]

Speaker: Varl
Text: Take the one on the right.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’ll take the one on the left.

Speaker: Varl
Text: Two more. You take the one on the left.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: There. See that covered shelter?

Speaker: Varl
Text: Do you see those Corruptors?!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Focus, Varl. That shelter ts full of Blaze. A whole stockpile of it. If set it off, the explosion will destroy those Corruptors and collapse the wall too.

Speaker: Varl
Text: A breach for the Nora to charge through. Can’t hit from here though. We’ll need to get closer.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’ll get closer. You head back, tell Sona the plan, and lead them to that side of the ring.

Speaker: Varl
Text: I’ll see it done. And when the wall collapses, I’ll be first through the breach.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Now all I have to do it make it all happen. Just need to get an angle on that Blaze and shoot it. Should be able to hit the Blaze from here.
[Nora burst into the camp and killed the warriors inside. Aloy helps to destroy a large machine.]

Speaker: Varl
Text: All Mother, look upon our victory! A debt of blood is paid. Remember this day, brave Nora.

Speaker: Sona
Text: From your lips to the Goddess’ ears. Yes, remember it. Be ready to leave this place. Let your spears and arrows rest in the bodies of the fallen -- they are tainted, like these ruins.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: It’s over. They won’t be able to kill again. The killers, this corruption -- they’re all parts of the mystery I’m chasing. Where the trail leads, I go. I need to find Olin and learn everything he knows. Who the killers were. How they saw me through his Focus.
[Aloy enter a settlement named Daytower to find Captain Balahn.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Captain Balahn? The guard at the gate said you’d been to Meridian recently. What can I expect on the trail?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Nothing good - more machines all the time, and our scouts report corruption of that way, as well. So much for sealing things off. Keep to the roads, they’re safe enough. Though after what you did at the gate, I’ll wager you don’t scare easily - it’s a good quality. I could put it to use, if you don’t mind a quick jaunt back east. I know it’s bold of me to ask a favor after you just did one. But I can offer answers in return, if there’s anything you need to know about the Sundom.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What do you need, Captain?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: I sent several patrols east when we got word of corrupted machines there. All of them confirmed my fears, so I sealed the gates. But it looks like we left some men behind when they were closed. Walid, tell her what happened.

Speaker: Walid
Text: machines attack us near an abandoned Nora village, sir. Lakhir told us to pull back, when I lost sight of the others.

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Never seen a Nora woman before? Have some respect. Report to her, not to me.

Speaker: Walid
Text: Lakhir always stresses reporting back, so that’s what I did. I felt terrible about leaving them behind.

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Now that the gates are open again, I can send someone after them.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Can’t you send more soldiers to find the missing men? What about Walid here?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Most Nora still don’t take well to the sight of Carja armor. Officially it’s a risk to send patrols so close to your Sacred Land. I’d prefer not to do that again. But heading that way one big problem for you.

Speaker: Walid
Text: Please say yes.

Speaker: Balahn
Text: What was that, soldier?

Speaker: Walid
Text: Nothing, Sir.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What is this place, exactly?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Daytower marks the eastern edge of culture territory - a trading post, a waystation… one with an ugly reputation among your people. During the reign of the last Sun-King, many Nora were taken captive, then you gathered here for transport to Meridian... and sacrifice. But the Sun’s set on that. I was appointed by Sun-King Avad to make sure all Carja at this outpost show respect to the Nora.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Where do things stand between your tribe and the Nora now?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Sun-King Avad wants peace. So do the Matriarchs, I’m told. But old wounds are slow to mend, and both tribes are proud. My task is to make sure there are no further provocations from the Sundom. Especially now, after, well… While your people recover from this terrible attack, I mean.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What’s Meridian like?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: It’s a changed place, a living city. Nothing like it was during the rule of Sun-King Jiran. Avad, our new king, has done all he can to make sure of that. Slavery has been abolished. There’s a new alliance with the Oseram. And the Sun-Ring, where so many outlander were killed, is now a memorial to the fallen.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: It sounds like you approve of the new Sun-King.

Speaker: Balahn
Text: He is the chosen of the Sun. And what the Sundom needs after ten years of war - a calming light not a scouring one. Sun- King Jiran who shed blood at any slight. For Sun-King Avad, that’s the last resort. Lucky for those who slight him. Some whisper in the shadows that he’s weak. No. Peace is strength, as the Sun shall show.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So the Carja are allied with the Oseram?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Hard to believe, but it’s true. Mad Sun-King Jiran raided the Oseram for years. Avad managed to get them on his side. He had help, of course. Ersa and Erend played a part - Oseram siblings, bigger than life. They gathered an army to free Meridian. I marched with them. Scaled the north cliff with my men and secured the Temple of the Sun. Sent Jiran’s kestrels and priests packing. Now Oseram are a common sight in the city. And a common sound - they sure bicker a lot.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Is there anything more you can tell me about the road to Meridian?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Sun-King Avad has devoted considerable resources to making it safe. But by the Sun’s witness... It’s been harder to control in peace than it was during the war. The machines grow more dangerous all the time. Add to that bandits, and new reports of this corruption... We’re stretched thin to protect a few outposts like this one. As for everywhere else, well travel at your own risk.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Did an Oseram named Olin come through here?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Twice. He was part of the royal delegation to the Nora, and they passed through on the way, then back. They brought back stories of a vicious attack on your people. My condolences, of course.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Do you know where Olin is now?

Speaker: Balahn
Text: Not exactly, but he was on his way to Meridian, I’m certain of that. Everyone goes to Meridian.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’ll see what I can do about your missing men.

Speaker: Balahn
Text: I would be grateful - but not as grateful as Walid. Hear that, lunkhead? You might be off the hook.
[Aloy leave captain be.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I need to find Olin and learn everything he knows. Who the killers were. How they saw me through his Focus. Who the woman is -- the one who looks like me. Why they want me dead. Olin’s trail leads to Meridian. When I catch him, he will talk... and he will pay for all the lives he’s ruined...
[After many days of travel, she gets to Meridian. On the bridge leading to the entrance to the city, she sees a large crowd of citizens and soldiers.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What’s going on here? Olin’s in there, somewhere. And so’s Erend, that other outlander I talked to the night before the Proving. Erend said he’d introduce me to his sister if visited Meridian. Said she was captain of the Vanguard.

Speaker: Carja Artisan
Text: City’s locked down, on account of the murder. Good luck getting through, outlander.

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: Halt! Stop right there! In light of the recent attack, no stranger passes into Meridian without submitting to.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Recent attack? What are you talking about?

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: The murder of Captain Ersa and her Vanguards, of course! Ambushed by Shadow Carja, forces in Red Ridge Pass!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Ersa? You mean Erend’s sister is dead?

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: How would you know his name?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I know Erend. Summon him. I need to speak to him.

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: Ha! I doubt that Erend, the new Captain of the Vanguard, a man in grief, is going to waste his time on a grimy outlander-

Speaker: Erend
Text: Aloy?! You’re alive! I thought you were dead! Make way, make way! All the way to Meridian just to see me?!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Have you been drinking?

Speaker: Erend
Text: Ah, not really. A little. So you’re alive! This is we shout celebrate! Drinks on me!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: We need to talk alone. And you need to pull it together.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Over there.

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: So you approve-

Speaker: Erend
Text: Of course I approve! From now on she may come and go from this city as she pleases!

Speaker: Carja Guard
Text: As you wish, sir.

Speaker: Erend
Text: There. Alone, as you asked. What did you want to tell me?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I heard what happened to Ersa. I’m sorry. I know she was special to you.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Special to me. Heh! Special to everyone! She always knew what to do. Bossed everyone around - she kept me in line. Now I’m supposed to fill her shoes. And instead, here I am, stumbling around in them.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Give yourself time. You’ll find your footing.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Not at the rate I’ve been drinking.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: And what would your sister have said about that?

Speaker: Erend
Text: I know, you’re right. I should expect more of myself. She always did.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: A lot has happened since we last spoke. The Proving was attacked by a group of killers. Not many of us survived.

Speaker: Erend
Text: We were in the village when we heard explosions, up on the mountain. Some of your braves came back, said most of the contestants were dead. I’ve never heard such a wail of grief as the sound that rose up from your people. How did you survive?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: How I survived is less important than how I was targeted.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Targeted? What do you mean?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The killers came for me. Because of Olin.

Speaker: Erend
Text: What are you talking about? That doesn’t make sense.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I need to find Olin. I need to know what he knows.

Speaker: Erend
Text: But he’s a friend!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: No, he’s a traitor. I don’t know who the killers are, or what they want, but I do know that Olin is working with them.

Speaker: Erend
Text: But... I... this…

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I don’t need you to understand, Erend. I just need you to take me to him.

Speaker: Erend
Text: He’s not here. He went scrounging for scrap and relics days ago. Could be anywhere.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Are there any places he frequents? Places he returns to?

Speaker: Erend
Text: A house - here in Meridian.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Then take me there need to search it.

Speaker: Erend
Text: I guess. As long as I’m there to witness the search...

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I need to see Olin’s place. Now.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Okay, okay. Come on.
[They’re walk to Olin’s house.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So many people here, all talking at once. How does anyone think?

Speaker: Erend
Text: I don’t. I just drink.
[Soon they hear someone’s loud voice.]

Speaker: Oseram Outlander
Text: Blood for blood! Vengeance for Ersa!! How long will Avad hide in his palace? To lay siege to the Citadel? Does he lack the stomach for justice? Year after year, why does he spare those who enslaved and tortured and butchered? Erend! You should want vengeance more than anyone! Your own sister, murdered?! And her death - unavenged?!

Speaker: Erend
Text: One more word, you scorched-out slag, and I’ll throw you in jail myself! Get out of here, or I’ll give you all a kick in the ass!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What did he mean about Ersa’s murder?

Speaker: Erend
Text: Not now.
[They’re coming up to Olin’s house.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Ok, how are we going to get in?
[Erend kicks the door out.]

Speaker: Erend
Text: Hngh!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Oh. That was... subtle.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Here we are. Try not to break anything. Uh, other than the door.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: All of this? For one man?

Speaker: Erend
Text: It pays to have connections in the Sun King’s court.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: This comer of this rug is frayed. And the floor near it is worn. Let’s see what’s underneath.
[Under the carpet is a solid door with wooden latches.]

Speaker: Erend
Text: Hey how did that get here?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The question is how to get through it.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Without a key, you won’t. That’s a Vault Hatch of Oseram make! Nothing gets through.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: We’ll see about that.

Speaker: Erend
Text: I don’t think you’re getting through that hatch.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Are you sure you’re okay?

Speaker: Erend
Text: I’m sober enough, all right? I don’t need another lecture!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: That’s not what I meant. I was talking about what happened outside with the crowd.

Speaker: Erend
Text: I don’t want to talk about that. We’re here because of what you said about Olin, so do what you need to do.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Did Olin ever invite you in?

Speaker: Erend
Text: No. Closest I got was the doorstep, to help him home after a nightout. We drank a river that night, but I hold it well. Usually.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You said Olin has connections in the royal court. Does he know the Sun-King personally?

Speaker: Erend
Text: No. He served the court as a scout sometimes, and sold ancient trinkets to nobles. But he never had an audience with the king. If you’re right and Olin’s into something dark, Sun-King Avad has nothing to do with it. I’d stake my life on that.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’ll look around.

Speaker: Erend
Text: That’s what we came for.
[She’s going up to the second floor.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: It looks like a picture of Olin’s family. A lot of metal here. Could be just what I need. Looks big and heavy. Could do a lot of damage if it fell down. Let’s give it a little push.
[She pushes a pallet of ingots down the hatch.]

Speaker: Erend
Text: I did say not to break anything, didn’t I? Aren’t you going to see what’s down there?
[Aloy descents into Olin’s secret workshop and read a file with her Focus.]

Speaker: Unknown Man
Text: Serve, and they live. Disobey, and I will open their throats and leave their corpses to prune in the sun.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: They took his wife and child captive.

Speaker: Erend
Text: "They?" Who’s "they?"

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The killers. They told him to obey or they’d kill his family.
[She keeps searching the workshop.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: A map. The glyphs show places he visited. Looks like Olin kept a journal.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Olin? I knew he could read contracts, but I never took him for a poet.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: No doubt now. Olin knew I was targeted. There’s your proof. Read the last page. He writes about meeting me - and the order to kill me.

Speaker: Erend
Text: He called himself a friend. That backstabbing cheat! How did you learn to read glyphs? And these things that you see - how do you do it?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The Focus. It reveals the unseen.

Speaker: Erend
Text: And Olin’s Focus it’s the same?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The device is the same, but somehow Olin and the killers can speak to each other with their Focuses over distances. And see through each other’s Focuses, too - like looking through each other’s eyes.

Speaker: Erend
Text: So that’s how the killers saw you? Through Olin?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Yes. So far as I can tell. Now that know where to find Olin, I should be on my way.

Speaker: Erend
Text: All by yourself?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Leave it to me. I’m faster on my own.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Wait! If that device lets you see the unseen-

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Out of the way, Erend.

Speaker: Erend
Text: I’m asking you to help me, Aloy! I need to know who killed Ersa! Not just the Shadow Carja army - I know that - but the exact soldiers who did it.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’m sorry about your sister, but that’s your war, not mine.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Don’t act like this isn’t personal! You came here hunting the people who nearly killed you, who massacred your people. But why should you have justice, and not me?

Speaker: Erend
Text: Look. I’ll head for Red Ridge Pass - where Ersa’s body was found - and wait for you there. A few minutes of your Focus is all I need. Don’t make me beg.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Red Ridge Pass, you said? I’ll see what I can do.
[She pays a visit to the Hunting Lodge.]

Speaker: Ligan
Text: You need to win three Half Suns at our Hunting Grounds to gain admittance to the Lodge.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You mean these?

Speaker: Ligan
Text: Very well then. Congratulations, and welcome. Our members reap rewards and adventure, and live on in legend.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Am I a member now?

Speaker: Ligan
Text: No, you’re only a fledgling, Junior members are called Thrushes. To join and become a Thrush, you need a senior member, called a Hawk, to sponsor you.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So I need to find a Hawk.

Speaker: Ligan
Text: Yes, but a Hawk can only sponsor one hunter at a time, and I’m afraid most of them already have one.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’ve overcome worse odds. Where do I start?

Speaker: Ligan
Text: Upstairs. Present yourself to the Sunhawk Ahsis, our leader, who should introduce you to a Hawk. I hope it’s worth it.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What do you mean?

Speaker: Ligan
Text: You’ll see.

Speaker: Aidaba
Text: By the Sun! King Avad’s edict really is taking effect. Never thought I’d see a Nora here. So, you have marks for me?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What do you mean?

Speaker: Aidaba
Text: From the Hunting Grounds? Oh, right. You’re new here.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What edict?

Speaker: Aidaba
Text: King Avad insisted that the Hunters Lodge had to welcome everyone -- man, woman, outlander -- regardless of tribe. Ersa, Captain of the Vanguard, came in and delivered that news personally. You should’ve been there. It was glorious. But I figured they would sweep it under the rug and say no woman or outlander qualified. Yet here you are.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Are you a member?

Speaker: Aidaba
Text: Me? No. Carja don’t exactly encourage their daughters to run around hunting machines. But all these changes have been good for me. I don’t think the Oseram know how to sell us to us Carja. The trader I worked for last couldn’t sell flowers to a bee. He was too plain-hammered, as they like to say. This is a much better job, I figure I’ll be able to open my own shop soon enough.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What do you want with my marks?

Speaker: Aidaba
Text: You hunters and your badges. I’m not going to take them. I’m going to give you a weapon that sets you apart. Yeah, I thought that’d get your attention. If you earn marks in all three Trials at each of the five hunting grounds, come to me. I can give you up to three weapons, one for fifteen Half Suns, one for fifteen Full Suns, and one you’ll love for all Blazing Suns.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What do I do with these marks?

Speaker: Aidaba
Text: If you get the same mark from all the Hunting Ground Trials, I can give you a Hunters Lodge weapon. Show me what marks you’ve earned, and we’ll see if you qualify for one of these special weapons I have for you.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’m a little short on marks.

Speaker: Aidaba
Text: No problem. Once you have marks from all fifteen trials, you’ll be able to get the next Hunters Lodge weapon from me.
[Aloy goes to search for Olin and finds him at some excavation site. There the Cultists dig up ancient machines.]

Speaker: Olin
Text: This is what you intend? To bring these ancient... things back to life?

Speaker: Cultist Leader
Text: Their power serves us.

Speaker: Olin
Text: Machine demons, from beneath the ground? It’s a nightmare!

Speaker: Cultist Leader
Text: Nightmares - yes! The worst dreams of our enemies, come true!
[He notices that one of the machines activates and raises his hands to the sky.]

Speaker: Cultist Leader
Text: Yes, rise!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So much for catching him alone.

Speaker: Olin
Text: These things will destroy us all!

Speaker: Cultist Leader
Text: They will only destroy our enemies and bring us back the lands that were taken-
[He screams in pain. Olin and Aloy has discomfort too.]

Speaker: Olin
Text: My Focus! It stopped working!

Speaker: Cultist Leader
Text: Search the area! We may have intruders!
[Someone talks to Aloy through her Focus.]

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: Forgive this intrusion, Aloy, you left me no choice.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Who is this.

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: An interested party. Now their Focuses are disabled, but I don’t know for how long. The rest is up to you.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Who is this?
[The caller disconnects. Aloy kill all the Cultists and two Corruptors. Now it’s time to talk to Olin. She catch him on the ground and puts her spear to his neck.]

Speaker: Olin
Text: I promise I’ll tell you everything!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I know you will. The killers who came for me at the Proving. Who are they?

Speaker: Olin
Text: The Eclipse. Some kind of holy warriors, a cult of the Shadow Carja.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Shadow Carja?

Speaker: Olin
Text: Except they’re not like any Carja I’ve known. They don’t pray to the Sun. They worship some kind of devil.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’m not interested m their superstitions.

Speaker: Olin
Text: Oh it’s not a superstition. Their devil is real. It has a name, a voice the most terrible voice And they do its bidding.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You say this “devil” the Eclipse worship has a name?

Speaker: Olin
Text: Hades. That’s what they call it.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Hades. And you’ve heard it speak?

Speaker: Olin
Text: Steel to my soul, I heard. Just once - when it saw you. Such a voice... A cold, awful jangle that scrapes your bones and hollows your guts. A metal sound, but like nothing dug from the earth or smelted in a forge.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: And what did it say?

Speaker: Olin
Text: “System threat detected.” Just three words... but in the voice of a devil.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What are these Eclipse cultists after? Besides me?

Speaker: Olin
Text: They never said. But given the Carja civil war, they must want to overthrow Sun King Avad and take Meridian back.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What do I have to do with that?

Speaker: Olin
Text: I don’t know.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: When they attacked the Proving, a man came forme. Tall, strong, dead eyes.

Speaker: Olin
Text: Helis!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: And who is he?

Speaker: Olin
Text: The Terror of the Sun. Stacker of Corpses, we Oseram called him, when he was the Mad Sun King’s champion. If only he’d died with his king. But now he leads the Eclipse. I tell you, he’s the most dangerous man alive.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: How did the Eclipse recruit you? I know they took your family hostage - but why you?

Speaker: Olin
Text: I was a scrounger. A rummager in dark places, good at what I do. I suppose they knew I would serve them well as a scout. I had taken a delve near Maker’s End. When I surfaced, they were waiting. I laughed when I saw the priest. But then he showed me Helis’ encouragement. I didn’t laugh after that. Gave me a Focus, to watch my every move. I followed orders.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You had access to Meridian. Why didn’t they get to Avad through you?

Speaker: Olin
Text: Too much dirt under my nails for an audience with the One True Sun King. But whatever Ersa or Erend told me... The Eclipse heard every word through my Focus. That’s why I couldn’t warn you. If I’d tried, they would have killed my family.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Why are the Eclipse digging up ancient machines? And how do they get them to work?

Speaker: Olin
Text: I thought they wanted them for scrap. But they brought them back to life! Plugged some kind of device into the corpses so that Hades could whisper to them and call them from their grave.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’ve fought that kind of machine before. Are there others?

Speaker: Olin
Text: Yes The ones you fought today, they call “Corrupters.” But there are others, much bigger, bristling with ancient weapons. Those they call “Deathbringers.” I’ve only seen them buried in the ground, but after today - anything is possible.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Sounds to me like they’re raising an army.

Speaker: Olin
Text: If so, the world will fall. And help dig the pit.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The Eclipse were sent to kill me because I look like another woman - older, maybe twice my age. Short hair. Who is she?

Speaker: Olin
Text: I don’t know. My Focus found her image once-in the ruins at Maker’s End. Maybe you can find her there.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You found her image in the ruins? How?

Speaker: Olin
Text: There was a door, and beside it, a kind of ancient device that... contained the woman’s image. My Focus recorded the location. You do look like her. Is she your mother?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’m the one asking questions. I’ve heard enough. It’s time to finish this.

Speaker: Olin
Text: I won’t beg for my life. But if there’s any mercy in you, free my family. Please.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Where would I find them?

Speaker: Olin
Text: My Focus recorded the location. There are always guards there. You look like you can handle yourself.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: It will take many good deeds to make up for the crimes you’ve committed.

Speaker: Olin
Text: You’re sparing me? After all I’ve done?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Yes. Forge a new life, Olin. One of better make.

Speaker: Olin
Text: Then the rest of my life will be lived in your debt!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Go to the place where your family is being held and wait for me. We’ll make their lives the first ones you save.

Speaker: Olin
Text: I didn’t earn this mercy, but I will die to make myself worthy of it. I will be waiting for you.
[Aloy going to help Erend find his sister. On the spot they’re attacked by several machines. The heroes defeats them without any problems.]

Speaker: Erend
Text: Glad that’s over with. Thanks for the help. Come on over here and have a word. Come on, what are you waiting for? What, don’t feel like talking?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What are you doing out here all alone? Where are your men?

Speaker: Erend
Text: I’m not gonna risk their lives. I don’t mind putting my worthless ass on the line. But not theirs. Sorry I had to drag you into it.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Don’t worry. This is just an average day for me. You know, take down some machines, track some killers.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Right. I’d hate to see a busy morning for you. Ready to get started?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Are you sure you’re all right?

Speaker: Erend
Text: Well, I’m sober. So... no.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Well, I’m glad you’re thinking straight, at least.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Don’t get used to it.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Tell me exactly what happened to Ersa. Start from the beginning.

Speaker: Erend
Text: No one knows for sure She left m the middle of the night with a few of her best men.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Her best men? But she didn’t bring you?

Speaker: Erend
Text: No... I’d been drinking a lot. Maybe she thought... Damn. I don’t know. That I couldn’t hack it. Search parties found their bodies the next day, and the corpses of some Shadow Carja cowards. It was an ambush. The Shadow Carja are animals. They beat her so bad we can’t even show her face before burial.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’m so sorry, Erend.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Yeah, well - when I find the soldiers who did this, they’ll be sorry, too.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You don’t have any idea why she left in the middle of the night?

Speaker: Erend
Text: No. But it must have been urgent. A message. A report of some new Shadow Carja threat. I don’t know.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Why would the Shadow Carja do this?

Speaker: Erend
Text: Because they hate us, and Ersa most of all. She teamed up with Avad to kick their asses out of Meridian. They’ve been licking their wounds fer two years, but they finally found a way to get back at her.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: All right. Show me where Ersa fell, and I’ll do what I can to help.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Come on, follow me.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Why would Ersa come all the way out here?

Speaker: Erend
Text: I don’t know. It doesn’t make sense.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Is this Shadow Carja territory?

Speaker: Erend
Text: No. They broke the cease fire as soon as they set foot in the Cleft. Almost there. This is it - where the ambush happened. Our soldiers have been over it, but maybe that fancy artifact of yours can find a clue or something. Please. I need to find the bastards that did this.
[Aloy beginning to investigate the murder scene.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: There look like drag marks. Did someone move a body through here? Arrows scattered there. Must be Shadow Carja armor. Strange. Not a scratch on it…

Speaker: Erend
Text: What do you see there?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: This stain forms alone, as if blood dripped off the edge of something. Like a cart. See? Cart tracks I me someone moved the bodies here then scattered them across the field.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Wait. Are you saying the dead found here were killed somewhere else? But why would the Shadow Carja do that?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: At this point, I’m not taking it for granted that the Shadow Carja are responsible.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Of course they were! I get why they wanted Ersa dead. But why fake an ambush?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: There’s more to this, and we’re going to figure it out.
[They’re going up the mountain where an ambush awaits.]

Speaker: Erend
Text: These guys aren’t Shadow Carja. They’re from my tribe, the Oseram!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Is this how your people usually greet each other?
[The battle begins. A lot of archers upstairs and a few lightly armed infantry downstairs. Soon the heroes hear some sound.]

Speaker: Erend
Text: Uh-oh. What’s that?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I think it’s calling machines. Get ready.
[Together, they defeat all opponents pretty quickly.]

Speaker: Erend
Text: Oseram, not Shadow Carja Looks like I was wrong about everything. As usual. Please, use that second sight of yours I have to know what really happened.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’m on it.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: These racks are… shattered. Something hit these stones. Something I’ve never seen before. So much blood. A lot of people died here - a massacre. What are those leather straps? Armor straps, cut with a knife. And a rock with blood on it. These look like Vanguard weapons. There’s no blood on them. Ersa’s men didn’t fight back. Looks like you could mount some equipment on that thing. There, by the tripod - a used power cell.

Speaker: Erend
Text: This is Ersa’s helmet. I thought she died in the field below, but it must have been here. All this trickery. For what? Feels like it’s just to torture me.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I have a theory. But it takes a little imagination…

Speaker: Erend
Text: So far you theories are better than other people’s facts.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: All right. I think the Oseram ambushed Ersa and her men with a new weapon. They mounted it on that tripod up there. It fires waves of force, maybe sound. Looks like it cracked the stone there. I think it paralyzes people instead of killing them. It dropped the Vanguard right there. No blood on their weapons, no fight.

Speaker: Erend
Text: But why paralyzed of them if you’re only going to move them and gut them?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: They were trying to hide something. Look here, a bloody rock.

Speaker: Erend
Text: That they used to smash Ersa’s face in.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Or someone else’s. These leather straps have been cut. As if they took the armor off someone.

Speaker: Erend
Text: That can’t be. Her body is lying in state in Meridian. I saw it!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You said she was unrecognizable. Maybe they switched another body into her armor, someone around the same size... and mutilated it enough so it could have been anyone even Ersa. Go back to Meridian. Take another look at that body. If it’s really Ersa, of course I’m wrong. But if I’m right...

Speaker: Erend
Text: Then my sister could be alive! I’m going. Meet me back there when you can!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Maker’s End. Not much farther now. Olin said he found an image of the woman I resemble on an ancient device. If she’s my mother, why would there be traces of her all the way out here - so far from Nora land? I don’t get it. Who is she?

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: Her name is Elisabet Sobeck.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You - spying through my Focus again! Well - go on. What do you know about her?

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: Stay on your present course and before long, you’ll know her as well as I do. Maybe better. But be wary. Maker’s End is crawling with Eclipse troops. To help you deal with them, I’ve left some useful equipment just outside the ruins. Your Focus will show the location.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Who is he, and how does he know these things? "Elisabet Sobeck," he said. What kind of name is that?
[She find the secret stash.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Right where he said it’d be. Not a bad selection. I’ll put it to use. Why are you doing this?

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: Because I want you to succeed. Good hunting. We’ll talk later.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Wait! Damn him!
[She kills the cultists and corrupted watcher at an excavation site. It seems there was a huge and luxurious building once.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: All these ruins. What did the Old Ones do here? Watchers acting as guards. The Eclipse and corrupted machines - cooperating. One happy family. A Corrupter... that might prove a challenge. An explosion. The snow’s got bite out here. Another explosion.
[Soon she sees the Deathbringer - giant machine armed to the brim. Apparently Eclipse carried out excavations there blasting rock with the help of this monster. Aloy hides behind some rock.]

Speaker: Eclipse Officer
Text: Rotate turret! And fire! All weapons operational! Time to get it moving! And be quick about it! No daydreaming! Soon this demon will be up and running. Another Deathbringer to fill out the ranks! Aye!

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Has to be one of the “Deathbringers," Olin talked about. Fitting name. I never get into that tower unless I destroy that thing first.

Speaker: Eclipse Officer
Text: My Focus - it’s stopped working!

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: I’ve disabled his Focus. The rest is up to you.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’ll handle it. Steam’s blasting out. I wonder if those are weak points?
[She destroy this dreadful war machine.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Did it! Those things pack a punch. Alright... that Eclipse officer had a Focus. Let’s see what’s on it. Let’s see what you have to say.
[The Focus shows her waves of corruption. It’s surrounds Aloy and, if they had been real, it definitely would have killed her.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What... what is this?

Speaker: HADES
Text: The Entity... lives? Unacceptable... Unacceptable... Unacceptable...

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What the hell was that? Hades? Hey! Mysterious stranger! Did you see that?! No answer, huh? Figures. Things just keep getting stranger. I need to find a way inside the tower. Looks tight, but I can squeeze through.
[Inside, she sees a huge door.]

Speaker: Synthetic Voice
Text: Hold for Identiscan.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: One of these again.
[She is going to leave…]

Speaker: Synthetic Voice
Text: Genetic profile confirmed. Entry authorized. Greetings, Dr. Sobeck. Please, step inside. Dr. Sobeck, you are. Three hundred and fifty five thousand, five hundred and ten days overdue for your meeting with Mr. Faro. Please proceed to the 35th floor.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Wait. Three hundred and fifty thousand - that’s hundreds of years ago - What is going on?!
[It’s roughly 974 years ago, incredible! Aloy continues to explore laboratories. In on of it she finds an audio datapoint.]

Speaker: FAS Firmware Coder
Text: The protocols use poly phasic entangled waveforms. Quantum encryption, Black Quartz stuff, way beyond military-grade. That’s what you demanded, so that’s what we delivered.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: You don’t code something you can’t crack. All we need is a back door. Upload the latest service pack update and the problem goes away.

Speaker: FAS Firmware Coder
Text: You specifically forbade us from leaving anything resembling a back door in code. "Every protocol to Black Quartz standard." Your words. Look. If you need me to fudge some projections, it’s nothing we haven’t done before.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: I don’t need fudged projections! I need a way to reassert control over the Hartz-Timor swarm!

Speaker: FAS Firmware Coder
Text: I don’t know what to tell you, Ted. You’re asking the impossible.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So codes... they needed codes of some kind to control the machines? But they got out of control… Sounds bad.
[She goes to the main hall.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: A “Deathbringer.” Or a statue of one, anyway... A machine built to kill. And they honored it...?

Speaker: FAS Spokeswoman
Text: Welcome to Faro Automated Solutions, where all the problems of tomorrow are being solved... today! With over 25,000 human employees based in nations and corporate holdings across the globe, Faro leads the world in every sector of self sustaining, fully-automated technology. From revolutionary consumer products close to home, like the Faro Focus to the dynamic Chariot line of peacekeeping robots halting bloodshed in conflict zones across the globe. Faro remains committed to making the future smarter, brighter, safer... and always surprising. Faro Automated Solutions... for every problem of life, a smart solution.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So they made the Focus? 25,000 people? That’s bigger than a tribe. So they made machines and devices. I guess such things were common in their world. What was this place? What were they doing here?

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: It was a "corporation." A group of people, not unlike a tribe. And they made machines.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Yeah? Go on.

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: I have uploaded some data files to your Focus. They’ll help you understand.
[Here’s the files.]
[BIO: TED FARO]
[BIO: ELISABET SOBECK]
[HISTORY: FAS]
[DEFINITION: CORPORATION]
[Aloy scans another datapoint.]

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Now I know this must seem like a bizarre change in direction. I mean, we’re Faro Automated Solutions, right? #1 robotics firm in the world. Why would we clear our production slate to fabricate human-operated vehicles and weapons systems - the relics of the past? All I can say at this juncture is... trust me. We will be exploiting a massive, uh... growth opportunity by retooling and reallocating. So I will need revised projections of mass fabrication velocity across every pipeline within 36 hours.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So they were making machines, but then they stopped, to make... other kinds of weapons? Why?
[She goes up a floor.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The air. No smell to it, not even old death. Nothing natural. Another cave in... but I could get through. Whoa! I’ll bet I can use that as a ramp to get back up. Looks like I can climb here. Made it. Looks like the way up - what’s left of it. So people were angry at Faro. At the corporation. They blamed this place for something. Something bad.
[At the presentation room.]

Speaker: FAS Spokesman 1
Text: The BOR7 "Horus": Imagine your complete engagement ecosystem comprehensively managed by a high-speed learning machine network. Whether your need is to replace battlefield losses or intensify force projection, the Horus’s onboard manufacturing capabilities mean you’ll never get stuck waiting for the next arms delivery. Simply redefine your force parameters and the Horus will fabricate additional units to fill the ranks for an affordable per-unit licensing fee. Meanwhile, the biomass conversion systems of other Chariot line models allow them to keep the Horus fueled, repaired, and ready extending its operating tolerances beyond that of any competing Titan-class platform. That’s the Horus advantage. Always regulating, always ready. The future of automated warfare, made real today.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The Metal Devil. So these were Faro machines, too. "Manufacturing capabilities." They could make more of themselves? Then how would you ever stop them?

Speaker: FAS Spokesman 2
Text: The FSP5 "Khopesh" provides a one-size-fits-all solution to main battle force capability. Metamaterial construction delivers unmatched recoil dampening, allowing you to field any weapon package that conforms to your budget needs and conflict-resolution profile. Patented biomass conversion systems allow extended emergency operations with minimal environmental impact. Multilinear target processing provides simultaneous real-time threat analysis and legal review for autonomous domestic operations - or control can be slaved to the swarm’s neural network for weapons-free force application. Either way, when it’s time to call out the big guns, it’s time to call Khopesh.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The Deathbringer… So this was the heavy hitter. "Main battle force," indeed.

Speaker: FAS Spokesman 3
Text: The ACA3 "Scarab" combines conventional and information warfare capabilities none package. Designed for high speed, all terrain reconnaissance, it boasts the world’s highest survivability rating of any scout-class autonomous agent. Maybe it’s the Scarab’s emergency biomass conversion systems that ensure it always makes it back to base, even if fuel supply lines have been interdicted. Or maybe it’s the Scarab’s ability to slave enemy robots to its own network. Now that’s force multiplication. Add a prehensile manipulator arm that can handle a host a functions from 360-degree less-lethal riot management to surgical repairs of allied Chariot line models, and you’ve got the workhorse of any cutting edge peacekeeping fleet.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The Corrupter… “Slave enemy robots to its own network.” Sounds like it’s talking about how it corrupts machines…
[She continues her searches for Faro’s office.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Going to be a long way up. Frozen metal most of the way. Not making this easy, Dr. Sobeck. If plants can find a way to hang on up here. guess I can, too.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: ...that began when they engaged in unauthorized offensive operations against robots and human personnel of the Hertz-Timor Energy Combine. Now I wish that I could relate that the crisis has been... exaggerated. But... it’s not. The peacekeepers have not responded to stand-down codes, and… by all signs they appear to be replicating at a... precipitous rate. Now what I can promise you, can absolutely assure you, is that I am already devoting every possible resource towards reaching… a speedy conclusion to this issue. So when you hear the bad talk about us, against this company, in the days, maybe weeks to come... just bear in mind that we will get past this that a day’s coming when none of this will matter-

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Peacekeepers? That’s what they called their machines? They were built for war, not peace. Snow. It’s not getting any warmer out here. A way up. All it takes is a few good handholds... All right, made it. Wonder what we’ll find.

Speaker: Synthetic Voice
Text: All data has been erased from this device. Do you wish to deploy Alpha privilege to recover purged data?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Oh yes, I believe I do.

Speaker: Synthetic Voice
Text: A data file has been recovered.
[Aloy scans the file. It shows holograms that has been previously recorded.]

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Elisabet! Good to... it’s been years.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Where’s your legal team, Ted?

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: No need! I dropped all eighteen lawsuits the moment you landed! I assume your data confirms this?

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: All right. This promises to be interesting.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Perhaps we could have lunch brought in, get reacquainted...?

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: I know you, Ted. You’ve screwed something up - something big - or you wouldn’t have eaten the crow to get me here. So spit it out!

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: There’s a glitch in the Chariot line.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Your killer robots?

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Peacekeepers, yes. Those.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: So shut them down.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Obviously, Lis, we would if we could. They’re not responding.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Are telling me a swarm has gone rogue, Ted?

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: It’s worse than that.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Show me the data, then. And I’ll take that lunch - alone.
[The hologram ends.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Ted Faro brought Elisabet Sobeck here? But if they hated each other.

Speaker: Synthetic Voice
Text: Another datafile has been recovered.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: This isn’t a "glitch," it’s a catastrophe.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Fully aware. It’s bad.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: "Bad?"

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Jesus, Lis...

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: It’s not "bad," Ted. It’s apocalyptic. You built a line of killer robots -

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Peacekeepers!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: - that consume biomass as fuel -

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: In emergencies!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: - and you made them capable of self-replication.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Limited self-manufacture. Controlled.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Not anymore. The glitch severed chain-of-command. The only nation this swarm answers to now is itself.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: You think - ?!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Everything else is just - food. And at the rate it’s replicating, Ted, it will strip the Earth bare in fifteen months. We’re not talking fall of civilization, we’re talking Extinction!

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: I get it, Lis! So how do I stop it while it’s contained?

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: It’s not contained, it can’t be!

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: You know what I mean!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Right. Before the truth gets out, you mean.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Lis, I will do anything you say! Keep working it, and whatever you recommend, I’ll do!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: I’m going to hold you to that, Ted.
[The hologram ends.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: The Faro robots threatened all life on Earth? But somehow she defeated them! The world of the Old Ones fell, but life went on - or we wouldn’t be here.

Speaker: Synthetic Voice
Text: A final data file has been recovered.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: "Project: Zero Dawn?" Jesus, Lis! There has to be another way.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: If there were a nicer way to fix your mess, I would have proposed it.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: But this? This?! When I asked you to find a cure, I didn’t expect it to be worse than the disease!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: It’s not, Ted. It may be grim, but it’s our only chance. Now sign the proposal.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Sign it? I can’t sign that!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Yes, you can.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: That? Lis, I cannot in good conscience sign that!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: You’ve got a choice, Ted-

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: I know!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: I am speaking to you from a VTOL en route to U.S. Robot Command! In fifteen minutes, I meet with General Herres and the rest of the Joint Chiefs!

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: ...What? Are you crazy?!

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Now your choice is what I tell them. Sign, and I’ll tell them the wealthiest corporation on Earth has guaranteed the funds necessary to build Zero Dawn exactly as I’ve designed it. Or don’t sign- and I will make sure they and everyone else on this planet knows the real cause of the glitch.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: Jesus, Lis! You don’t have to threaten me. I’ll sign.

Speaker: Elisabet Sobeck
Text: Look on the bright side, Ted. From here on out you get to do what you’ve always been good at. Footing the bill while others get their hands dirty.

Speaker: Ted Faro
Text: God forgive me. ("I’m sorry" in the datapoint]
[The hologram ends.]

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What made her solution so terrible? What did she do to stop the robots?

Speaker: Synthetic Voice
Text: Executive access detected. Express lift opened.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: This doesn’t add up! Sobeck couldn’t have been my mother - she lived ages ago! All of this searching, and I’m still no closer!

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: That’s your reaction to everything you just learned? To whine like a spoiled child?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You should really try talking that way to me, face to face!

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: As you wish.
[He appears on her Focus. Surprisingly he looks like a wonderful actor Lance Reddick. I was truly shocked.]

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: Do you really have no idea how monumental are the discoveries you just made, Aloy? I expected more of you.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So you have a face. Got a name to go with it?

Speaker: Unknown Caller
Text: Of all the questions you could ask right now - that’s the one you choose? I’ve spent decades searching the ruins of the Old Ones, trying to solve the mystery of what happened to them. For years I’ve suspected that Faro robots destroyed their civilization... but could never confirm it! In minutes, you uncover more ancient knowledge than I have in a lifetime… and what you want to know - is my name?! Sylens. That’s my name. Now why don’t you try asking another question - something less trivial.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: All right "Sylens"... you’ve made your point. I came to these ruins hoping to learn more about this "Elisabet Sobeck." And I have, but I still don’t understand my connection to her. Or why the Eclipse is trying to kill me or who Hades is. No answers… just one question after another.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Exactly. Which is why it’s time to expand your frame of inquiry. Only then will you see just how big your problems really are.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What exactly are you talking about?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: You’ve chased a personal riddle into a crowd of larger mysteries. The common thread is your connection to Elisabet Sobeck.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: But what is that connection? She couldn’t have been my mother if she lived centuries ago!

Speaker: Sylens
Text: We don’t know the connection yet. The only way to find out is to keep going, to keep making discoveries. Thanks to you, we’ve only just now learned that Faro robots once threatened to end life on earth.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: But it didn’t happen! The Old Ones’ civilization was destroyed, but life - life was saved.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Obviously. So what did Elisabet do? How did she stop the robots before all was lost?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What was "Project: Zero Dawn ?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Exactly the question. Now, are you ready to go get the answer?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Of course I am.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Then why are you still standing here?

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Not so fast, Sylens. You’ve got some explaining to do.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: I’ve told you quite enough. If you’ve still got questions, be quick about it and stop wasting my time.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You said you’ve known for some time that Faro war machines destroyed the civilization of the Old Ones?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: The evidence pointed that way. But until now, I never knew the full scope on their danger- that they could process organic matter into fuel, or that the “Horus” class could manufacture more robots - like a Cauldron on legs.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: But the robots we’ve seen so far - the Corrupters and Deathbringers - they don’t do those things.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Not yet, anyway. So far, we haven’t encountered any that are undamaged. At full power, who knows what they’re capable of? Now if that’s enough talking, be on your way.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Oh no I’m just getting started. You’ve been getting a free ride on my Focus, risking nothing while I risk everything. All I have to do is take this thing off my head, and you’ll be blind, deaf, and dumb. So quit complaining and answer my questions.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Very well.  Proceed.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: So far as I can tell, the Eclipse are just following orders. It’s Hades who wants me dead. Who is he?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: I don’t know. The Eclipse describe him as a "Buried Shadow," some kind of devil.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: That thing that spoke to me outside, that made that Focus explode - that was Hades? It didn’t seem like a person, or a machine... more like a phantom with a terrible voice.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: All that’s assortment is a bad that he wants you dead.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Because of my connect on to Elisabet. Has to be.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Hades is using the Eclipse to resurrect Faro robots.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: But if Elisabet found a way to stop them centuries ago. If she made special weapons - maybe Hades is worried I’ll doing the same thing.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: In some of the ancient data I’ve recovered, there are hints of so-called "super weapons" being developed. Maybe to stop the robots, the civilization of the Old Ones had to destroy itself.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Who are you, Sylens - and what are your intentions?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: You really need to make this... personal? I’m a lone wanderer who left his tribe behind a long time ago. An explorer of forbidden places, a searcher of lost knowledge. Exactly as I said.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Why do you know so much about the Eclipse?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: I happen to know a lot about a lot of things. If what you’re really asking is whether I work for the Eclipse or anyone else, I don’t. I am nothing if not independent.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: You’ve been using my Focus to spy on me. How’s that possible?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Every Focus emits a signal - a voicechat only other Focuses can hear. I know how to string those voices together. How to make them talk to each other - to communicate, even over vast distances.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: How do you learn to do that?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Years of study and experimentation. In principle, it’s not so different from how you override machines. I override Focuses.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: And you can spy though other Eclipse’s Focuses, too?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: Usually. All I’ll say is that overriding their connections is… complicated.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Is there any chance that Elisabet Sobeck could still be alive somehow?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: It’s highly unlikely. But… not impossible. Some of the ancient data I’ve recovered includes mentions of life extension techniques. Pharmaceuticals, mostly - an ancient word for “medicine”, but some were still trying to perfect ways a freezing and unfreezing people.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Freezing and unfreezing people?

Speaker: Sylens
Text: "Cryogenics," they call it. But there were problems with it. Given Elisabet’s technological acumen, I can’t definitively rule out that she found a way to make herself immortal. But this is speculation - wasting time.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: Elisabet told Ted Faro she was headed for a place called U.S. Robot Command to tell people about Zero Dawn.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: The place still exists - as a ruin. The Oseram call it the "Grave-Hoard."

Speaker: Aloy
Text: "Grave-Hoard?” Cheery name.

Speaker: Sylens
Text: You’ll find it in the eastern mountains, buried under the tangled coils of a Metal Devil - B.O.R.-7 Horus, rather, as we’re learning to call them. I’ll contact you when you get there.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I can’t wait. Someday we’ll meet in person and your manners had better be improved. Well. Getting down will be a lot faster than getting up here, at least. U.S. Robotics Command next. To learn the secrets of Zero Down…
[Aloy comes to meet with Erend at the Palace of the Sun in Meridian.]

Speaker: Blameless Marad
Text: Greetings, Aloy. I am known as Blameless Marad. Please come with me - you’re needed for an important consultation.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What do you mean? Where’s Erend?

Speaker: Blameless Marad
Text: He’s inside, attending the Sun King. Where we should be, without further delay. Follow me, please.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: All of these people are here to see the Sun King?

Speaker: Blameless Marad
Text: Yes, and each has come to ask a favor of him. Unpleasant, but that’s politics. The Sun King is eager to meet you - the machine tamer with the curious eye for detail. It’s very intriguing.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: I’m not here to intrigue you.

Speaker: Blameless Marad
Text: Too late. Ignore them. Nobles are like children who whine when they don’t get a second helping of dessert.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: What’s the Sun-King like?

Speaker: Blameless Marad
Text: The most important thing is what he isn’t like - his father. I think you will find him to be a reasonable man.
[They approach the throne upon which the Sun-King himself sits. Next to him is Erend.]

Speaker: Avad
Text: Aloy of the Nora - she who sees the unseen. Welcome. It would seem you have done me a great service. Erend, tell her what you found.

Speaker: Erend
Text: I checked Ersa’s tomb. You were right, Aloy. The body’s missing a scar below her right knee. I gave it to Ersa when we were kids, fighting over a toy sword.

Speaker: Avad
Text: If the body is not Ersa’s, then we must assume she is still alive. And I will not abandon her.

Speaker: Aloy
Text: We only know she was taken. Not who took.

Speaker: Blameless Marad
Text: I can help with that. Ersa has an enemy among the Oseram - a warlord named Dervahl.

Speaker: Erend
Text: Impossible. Every clan in the Claim has been hunting for him since the Liberation. He has to be dead by now!

Speaker: Blameless Marad
